publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3764 Fiona Hyslop: Glasgow’s Gaelic School—That the Parliament notes the intention to make Woodside School in Glasgow the first all-through Gaelic school and the Scottish Executive’s commitment of £2.75 million towards the renovation of the school; further notes that construction industry inflation has increased the cost of the project from £3.5 million to the latest estimate of £4 million, and calls on the Executive to increase its support for the project in order to help address these cost increases. Supported by: Ms Sandra White*
S2M-3764 Glasgow’s Gaelic School (lodged on 20 December 2005) Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*

S2M-3764 Fiona Hyslop: Glasgow’s Gaelic School—That the Parliament notes the intention to make Woodside School in Glasgow the first all-through Gaelic school and the Scottish Executive’s commitment of £2.75 million towards the renovation of the school; further notes that construction industry inflation has increased the cost of the project from £3.5 million to the latest estimate of £4 million, and calls on the Executive to increase its support for the project in order to help address these cost increases. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Michael Matheson, Christine Grahame
S2M-3764 Glasgow’s Gaelic School (lodged on 20 December 2005) Linda Fabiani*
